name: Patrick J. HOPKINS, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, PA, and District Attorney of Philadelphia County, PA, Respondents
name_abbreviation: Hopkins v. Court of Common Pleas of Philadelphia County

pin_cites.parenthetical: providing that hybrid representation is improper
providing that hybrid representation is improper

parties: Patrick J. HOPKINS, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, PA, and District Attorney of Philadelphia County, PA, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 29th day of June, 2015, the Application for Leave to File Original Process and the Petition for Extraordinary Relief and/or Habeas Corpus Relief are DISMISSED. See Commonwealth v. Reid, 537 Pa. 167, 642 A.2d 453 (1994) (providing that hybrid representation is improper). The Pro-thonotary is DIRECTED to forward the filings to counsel of record.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
118 A.3d 384
Patrick J. HOPKINS, Petitioner v. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS OF PHILADELPHIA COUNTY, PA, and District Attorney of Philadelphia County, PA, Respondents.
No. 57 EM 2015.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
June 29, 2015.
